template.name: NEXUS 3xxx
template.description:
## Description
A template to monitor nexus switch via SNMP
## Overview
A Nexus 3xxx template to get SNMP system informations.
This template will find interface, CPU, Fan, create graphs, check ip/tcp/udp/icmp information, create some triggers etc...
All items, triggers and discovery rules have brief descriptions.
If SNMP is not your friend, you can check this web page (https://cric.grenoble.cnrs.fr/Administrateurs/Outils/MIBS/?oid=1.3.6.1.2.1) to help you.
## Author
Leo Cardao

item.name: ICMP IN Destination Unreachs (deprecated)
item.description: Get the number of ICMP Destination Unreachable messages received. (deprecated)

item.name: ICMP IN Echo Reps (deprecated)
item.description: Get the number of ICMP Echo Reply messages received. (deprecated)

item.name: ICMP IN Echos (deprecated)
item.description: Get the number of ICMP Echo (request) messages received. (deprecated)

item.name: ICMP IN Errors (deprecated)
item.description: Get the number of ICMP messages which the entity received but determined as having ICMP-specific errors (bad ICMP checksums, bad length, etc.). (deprecated)

item.name: ICMP IN Msgs (deprecated)
item.description: Get the total number of ICMP messages which the entity received. (deprecated)

item.name: ICMP IN Param Prob (deprecated)
item.description: Get the number of ICMP Parameter Problem messages received. (deprecated)

item.name: ICMP IN Redirects (deprecated)
item.description: Get the number of ICMP Redirect messages received. (deprecated)

item.name: ICMP IN Source Quenchs (deprecated)
item.description: Get the number of ICMP Source Quench messages received. (deprecated)

item.name: ICMP IN Time Excds (deprecated)
item.description: Get the number of ICMP Time Exceeded messages received. (deprecated)

item.name: ICMP IN Timestamp Reps (deprecated)
item.description: Get the number of ICMP Timestamp Reply messages received. (deprecated)

item.name: ICMP IN Timestamps (deprecated)
item.description: Get the number of ICMP Timestamp (request) messages received. (deprecated)

item.name: ICMP OUT Destination Unreachs (deprecated)
item.description: Get the number of ICMP Destination Unreachable messages sent. (deprecated)

item.name: ICMP OUT Echo Reps (deprecated)
item.description: Get the number of ICMP Echo Reply messages sent. (deprecated)

item.name: ICMP OUT Echos (deprecated)
item.description: Get the number of ICMP Echo (request) messages sent. (deprecated)

item.name: ICMP OUT Errors (deprecated)
item.description: Get the number of ICMP messages which this entity did not send due to problems discovered within ICMP, such as a lack of buffers. (deprecated)

item.name: ICMP OUT Msgs (deprecated)
item.description: Get the total number of ICMP messages which this entity attempted to send. (deprecated)

item.name: ICMP OUT Param Prob (deprecated)
item.description: Get the number of ICMP Parameter Problem messages sent. (deprecated)

item.name: ICMP OUT Redirects (deprecated)
item.description: Get the number of ICMP Redirect messages sent. (deprecated)

item.name: ICMP OUT Source Quenchs (deprecated)
item.description: Get the number of ICMP Source Quench messages sent. (deprecated)

item.name: ICMP OUT Time Excds (deprecated)
item.description: Get the number of ICMP Time Exceeded messages sent. (deprecated)

item.name: ICMP OUT Timestamp Reps (deprecated)
item.description: Get the number of ICMP Timestamp Reply messages sent. (deprecated)

item.name: ICMP OUT Timestamps (deprecated)
item.description: Get the number of ICMP Timestamp (request) messages sent. (deprecated)

item.name: IP Forwarding v4
item.description: Get the indication of whether this entity is acting as an IPv4 router in respect to the forwarding of datagrams received by, but not addressed to, this entity.

trigger.name: IP v4 Forwarding status changed
trigger.description: Inform admin to change state.

item.name: IP Frag Fails (deprecated)
item.description: Get the number of IPv4 datagrams that have been discarded because they needed to be fragmented at this entity but could not be, e.g., because their Don't Fragment flag was set. (deprecated)

trigger.name: New IP Frag Failed (deprecated)
trigger.description: This trigger inform admin that a new failure during fragmentation of an ipv4 packet occurred. This trigger need "IP Frag Failed (deprecated)" enabled item.

item.name: IP IN Addr Errors (deprecated)
item.description: Get the number of input datagrams discarded because the IPv4 address in their IPv4 header's destination field was not a valid address to be received at this entity. (deprecated)

trigger.name: New IP IN Addr Errors (deprecated)
trigger.description: This trigger inform admin than a new ipv4 error occurred because of a bad ip address format. This trigger need "IP IN Addr Errors (deprecated)" enabled item.

item.name: IP IN Delivers (deprecated)
item.description: Get the change per second of the total number of input datagrams successfully delivered to IPv4 user-protocols (including ICMP). (deprecated)

item.name: IP IN Discards (deprecated)
item.description: Get the change per second of the number of input IPv4 datagrams for which no problems were encountered to prevent their continued processing, but which were discarded (e.g., for lack of buffer space). (deprecated)

trigger.name: New IP IN Discard (deprecated)
trigger.description: Inform admin that some new IpV4 packet have been discard. This trigger need "IP IN Discard (deprecated)" enabled item.

item.name: IP IN headers Errors (deprecated)
item.description: Get the number of input datagrams discarded due to errors in their IPv4 headers, including bad checksums, version number mismatch, other format errors, time-to-live exceeded, errors discovered in processing their IPv4 options, etc.. (deprecated)

trigger.name: New IP IN headers Errors (deprecated)
trigger.description: This trigger inform admin than a new ipv4 header error occurred. This trigger need "IP IN headers Errors (deprecated)" enabled item.

item.name: IP IN Receives (deprecated)
item.description: Get the change per second of the total number of input IPv4 datagrams received from interfaces, including those received in error. (deprecated)

item.name: IP OUT Discards (deprecated)
item.description: Get the change per second of the number of output IPv4 datagrams for which no problem was encountered to prevent their transmission to their destination, but which were discarded (e.g., for lack of buffer space). (deprecated)

trigger.name: New IP OUT Discard (deprecated)
trigger.description: Inform admin that some new IpV4 packet have been discard. This trigger need "IP OUT Discard (deprecated)" enabled item.

item.name: IP OUT Requests (deprecated)
item.description: Get the change per second of the total number of IPv4 datagrams which local IPv4 user protocols (including ICMP) supplied to IPv4 in requests for transmission. (deprecated)

item.name: IP Reasm Fails (deprecated)
item.description: Get he number of failures detected by the IPv4 re-assembly algorithm (for whatever reason: timed out, errors, etc). (deprecated)

trigger.name: New IP Reasm Failed (deprecated)
trigger.description: This trigger inform admin that a new failure during reassembly an ipv4 packet occurred. This trigger need "IP Reasm Failed (deprecated)" enabled item.

item.name: IP Reasm Timeout
item.description: Get the maximum number of seconds that received fragments are held while they are awaiting reassembly at this entity.

trigger.name: IP Default TTL changed (deprecated)
trigger.description: Inform admin to change state.

item.name: IP IN Addr Errors v4
item.description: Get the number of input IPv4 datagrams discarded because the IPv4 address in their IP header's destination field was not a valid address to be received at this entity.

trigger.name: New IP IN Addr Errors ipv4
trigger.description: This trigger inform admin than a new ipv4 error occurred because of a bad ip address format.

item.name: IP IN Addr Errors v6
item.description: Get the number of input IPv6 datagrams discarded because the IPv6 address in their IP header's destination field was not a valid address to be received at this entity.

trigger.name: New IP IN Addr Errors ipv6
trigger.description: This trigger inform admin than a new ipv6 error occurred because of a bad ip address format.

item.name: IP IN Delivers v4
item.description: Get the change per second of the total number of datagrams successfully delivered to IPv4 user-protocols (including ICMP).

item.name: IP IN Delivers v6
item.description: Get the change per second of the total number of datagrams successfully delivered to IPv6 user-protocols (including ICMP).

item.name: IP IN Discards v4
item.description: Get the change per second of the number of input IPv4 datagrams for which no problems were encountered to prevent their continued processing, but were discarded (e.g., for lack of buffer space).

trigger.name: New IP IN Discard ipv4
trigger.description: Inform admin that some new IpV4 packet have been discard.

item.name: IP IN Discards v6
item.description: Get the change per second of the number of input IPv6 datagrams for which no problems were encountered to prevent their continued processing, but were discarded (e.g., for lack of buffer space).

trigger.name: New IP IN Discard ipv6
trigger.description: Inform admin that some new IpV6 packet have been discard.

item.name: IP IN headers Errors v4
item.description: Get the number of input IPv4 datagrams discarded due to errors in their IP headers, including version number mismatch, other format errors, hop count exceeded, errors discovered in processing their IP options, etc.

trigger.name: New IP IN headers Errors ipv4
trigger.description: This trigger inform admin than a new ipv4 header error occurred.

item.name: IP IN headers Errors v6
item.description: Get the number of input IPv6 datagrams discarded due to errors in their IP headers, including version number mismatch, other format errors, hop count exceeded, errors discovered in processing their IP options, etc.

trigger.name: New IP IN headers Errors ipv6
trigger.description: This trigger inform admin than a new ipv6 header error occurred.

item.name: IP IN Receives v4
item.description: Get the change per second of the total number of input IPv4 datagrams received from interfaces, including those received in error.

item.name: IP IN Receives v6
item.description: Get the change per second of the total number of input IPv6 datagrams received from interfaces, including those received in error.

item.name: IP OUT Discards v4
item.description: Get the change per second of the number of output IPv4 datagrams for which no problem was encountered to prevent their transmission to their destination, but were discarded (e.g., for lack of buffer space).

trigger.name: New IP OUT Discard ipv4
trigger.description: Inform admin that some new IpV4 packet have been discard.

item.name: IP OUT Discards v6
item.description: Get the change per second of the number of output IPv6 datagrams for which no problem was encountered to prevent their transmission to their destination, but were discarded (e.g., for lack of buffer space).

trigger.name: New IP OUT Discard ipv6
trigger.description: Inform admin that some new IpV6 packet have been discard.

item.name: IP Frag Fails v4
item.description: Get the number of IPv4 datagrams that have been discarded because they needed to be fragmented but could not be.

trigger.name: New IP v4 Frag Failed
trigger.description: This trigger inform admin that a new failure during fragmentation of an ipv4 packet occurred.

item.name: IP Frag Fails v6
item.description: Get the number of IPv6 datagrams that have been discarded because they needed to be fragmented but could not be.

trigger.name: New IP v6 Frag Failed
trigger.description: This trigger inform admin that a new failure during fragmentation of an ipv6 packet occurred.

item.name: IP OUT Requests v4
item.description: Get the change per second of the total number of IPv4 datagrams which local IPv4 user protocols (including ICMP) supplied to IPv4 in requests for transmission.

item.name: IP OUT Requests v6
item.description: Get the change per second of the total number of IPv6 datagrams which local IPv6 user protocols (including ICMP) supplied to IPv6 in requests for transmission.

item.name: IP Reasm Fails v4
item.description: Get he number of failures detected by the IPv4 re-assembly algorithm (for whatever reason: timed out, errors, etc).

trigger.name: New IP v4 Reasm Failed
trigger.description: This trigger inform admin that a new failure during reassembly an ipv4 packet occurred.

item.name: IP Reasm Fails v6
item.description: Get the number of failures detected by the IPv6 re-assembly algorithm (for whatever reason: timed out, errors, etc).

trigger.name: New IP v6 Reasm Failed
trigger.description: This trigger inform admin that a new failure during reassembly an ipv6 packet occurred.

item.name: IP Forwarding v6
item.description: Get the indication of whether this entity is acting as an IPv6 router in respect to the forwarding of datagrams received by, but not addressed to, this entity.

trigger.name: IP v6 Forwarding status changed
trigger.description: Inform admin to change state.

item.name: System description
item.description: Get the current system description.

trigger.name: System description changed
trigger.description: Inform admin to change state.

item.name: System Name
item.description: Get the current system name.

trigger.name: System name changed
trigger.description: Inform admin to change state.

item.name: System Time
item.description: Get the current system time.

item.name: TCP Attempt fails
item.description: Get the number of times that TCP connections have made a direct transition to the CLOSED state from either the SYN-SENT state or the SYN-RCVD state.

trigger.name: New TCP Attempt Failed
trigger.description: This trigger inform admin that a new TCP connection have made a direct transition to the CLOSED state from either the SYN-SENT state or the SYN-RCVD state.

item.name: TCP Established Resets
item.description: Get the number of times that TCP connections have made a direct transition to the CLOSED state from either the ESTABLISHED state or the CLOSE-WAIT state.

trigger.name: New TCP Established Resets
trigger.description: Inform admin that some new TCP connection have made a direct transition to the CLOSED state from either the ESTABLISHED state or the CLOSE-WAIT state.

item.name: TCP HC IN Segments
item.description: Get the change per second of the total number of segments received, including those received in error.

item.name: TCP HC OUT Segments
item.description: Get the change per second of the total number of segments sent, including those on current connections but excluding those containing only retransmitted octets.

item.name: TCP IN Errors
item.description: Get change per second of the total number of segments received in error (e.g., bad TCP checksums).

trigger.name: New TCP IN Errors
trigger.description: This trigger inform admin that a new TCP error occurred.

item.name: TCP IN Segments
item.description: Get the change per second of the total number of segments received, including those received in error.

item.name: TCP Max Connection
item.description: Get the max number of tcp connection allowed for this entity.

trigger.name: TCP Max Connection changed
trigger.description: Inform admin to change state.

item.name: TCP OUT Segments
item.description: Get the change per second of the total number of segments sent, including those on current connections but excluding those containing only retransmitted octets.

item.name: TCP RTO algorithm
item.description: Get the algorithm used to determine the timeout value used for retransmitting unacknowledged octets.

trigger.name: TCP RTO algorithm changed
trigger.description: Inform admin to change state.

item.name: TCP RTO max
item.description: Get the maximum value permitted by a TCP implementation for the retransmission timeout, measured in milliseconds.

trigger.name: TCP RTO max changed
trigger.description: Inform admin to change state.

item.name: TCP RTO min
item.description: Get the minimum value permitted by a TCP implementation for the retransmission timeout, measured in milliseconds.

trigger.name: TCP RTO min changed
trigger.description: Inform admin to change state.

item.name: UDP HC IN Datagrams
item.description: Get the change per second of total number of UDP datagrams delivered to UDP users, for devices that can receive more than 1 million UDP datagrams per second.

item.name: UDP HC OUT Datagrams
item.description: Get the change per second of total number of UDP datagrams sent from this entry, for devices that can receive more than 1 million UDP datagrams per second.

item.name: UDP IN Datagrams
item.description: Get the change per second of total number of UDP datagrams delivered to UDP users.

item.name: UDP IN Errors
item.description: Get the number of received UDP datagrams that could not be delivered for reasons other than the lack of an application at the destination port.

trigger.name: New UDP IN Errors
trigger.description: This trigger inform admin that a new UDP error occurred.

item.name: UDP No Ports
item.description: Get he total number of received UDP datagrams for which there was no application at the destination port.

trigger.name: New UDP No Ports
trigger.description: This trigger inform admin that a new 'UDP No Ports' error occurred.

item.name: UDP OUT Datagrams
item.description: Get the change per second of total number of UDP datagrams sent from this entry.

item_prototype.name: Fan {#SNMPVALUE} status
item_prototype.description: Get the fan status of this entity.

trigger_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} Fan status has changed
trigger_prototype.description: Inform admin that status have been changed.

item_prototype.name: CPU Memory Free
item_prototype.description: Get the overall CPU wide system memory which is currently free.

item_prototype.name: CPU Memory Used
item_prototype.description: Get the overall CPU wide system memory which is currently under use.

item_prototype.name: CPU Total pourcentage (1min)
item_prototype.description: Get the overall CPU busy percentage in the last 1 minute period.

trigger_prototype.name: Usage CPU hight
trigger_prototype.description: Inform admin than entity have CPU problem.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: IN Discards
item_prototype.description: Get the change per second of the number of inbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol.

trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: New IN discards
trigger_prototype.description: Inform admin than a new packet have been discard by the interface.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: IN Errors
item_prototype.description: For packet-oriented interfaces, get the change per second of the number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. For character- oriented or fixed-length interfaces, get the change per second of the number of inbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol.

trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: New IN Errors
trigger_prototype.description: Inform admin than a new error have been occurred on the interface.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: IN Octets
item_prototype.description: Get the change per second of the total number of octets received on the interface, including framing characters.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: OUT Discards
item_prototype.description: Get the change per second of the number of outbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being transmitted.

trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: New OUT discards
trigger_prototype.description: Inform admin than a new packet have been discard by the interface.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: OUT Errors
item_prototype.description: For packet-oriented interfaces, get the change per second of the number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted because of errors. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, get the change per second of the number of outbound transmission units that could not be transmitted because of errors.

trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: New OUT Errors
trigger_prototype.description: Inform admin than a new error have been occurred on the interface.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: OUT Octets
item_prototype.description: Get the change per second of the total number of octets sent on the interface, including framing characters.

trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: Interface status changed
trigger_prototype.description: Inform admin that the interface status have been changed.
